title: Utilizzo risorse
content:
Buongiorno, una domanda (curiosità): quando apro Mozilla Firefox e vado a vedere il Task manager di Microsoft Windows 10, vedo che Firefox apre tanti eseguibili (allegato foto) e tante finestre nella sezione Applicazioni (vedi allegato). Volevo capire perchè deve aprire così tante finestra e tanti eseguibili. Considerata che avevo aperto Mozilla Firefox con due finestre.

Grazie e complimenti per il browser (è il mio preferito).

Saluti.

Luca

title: Possible scam pretending to be Google
content:
I typed the following in a Google search box:

The 11th hour with Stephanie Ruhle interview with Martin O’Malley about Social Security

When I press enter the attached pop-ups alway come up on the screen, even after trying several times. (please see 2 attached images). I don't want to check the "I'm not a robot" box because it seems to be a scam. Please let me know if you have had any experience with this - is it a scam - and scam or not how can I stop this from happening????? Thank you, George

title: ugly display of chinese fonts of add-ons setting page on macOS
content:
I am a Chinese user of Firefox for at least 7 years.

Recently I bought a macbook and I found that in add-ons setting page [about:addons], there is a blank near by text. It is scroll button actually, but it is so ugly. And on Windows system, there is no such problem. I thought it might be due to default font of macOS.

So please help me settle such problem.

title: Location problem with Google Maps
content: Using Firefox 142.0.1 (64-bit) in Windows 11 PC (24H2). When I open Google Maps it seems always to center on a point 7 miles away instead of on my current (home) location. When I seek travel directions from "Your location", the route starts from that incorrect point. If I click the location button on the bottom right of the map, I get the message"Your precise location could not be determined." But, when I click the location button twice more, it says "Getting current location" and then blue dot appears at my current location. Routes now start from this location. But when I close and reopen Google Maps, the incorrect approximate location comes back up. (Note Google Maps shows correct location in Microsoft Edge). I tired several times to toggle Firefox's Location permission (Allow/Block; Remove website/Allow; with and without reboot) without any change. The Google forum had no viable suggestions. I'd appreciate any ideas for a fix from this group.
creator: rrrvjjj

title: Is there a reason that the Firefox family has to curate such left wing propaganda websites for normal Americans to read?
content: The Firefox family clearly has great disdain for the average American who doesn't want to be forced to read DNC / Democrat talking points via the "curated thread". Just be honest: it's the DNC curating Firefox's news just as the FBI curated who was allowed to talk on X. Just be up front with everyone. Firefox is sort of like the Bluesky of internet browsers. Here is a crazy concept: Instead of shoving your views down the throats of average Americans. How about let us citizens choose are own news sources? Crazy concept. Or are you Big Brother? Seriously. Get a clue if you want the 60% of ordinary people to keep using your browser as I have done for 15 years give or take. I get that I can turn off the propaganda your are displaying but choice would be better. If you would like to discuss, I'm all ears.
creator: gregersonart

title: Unable to log in to Firefox
content: Somehow, I was logged out of my Firefox account on my PC laptop. Because I forgot my password, I went through the process of changing it. I received a confirmation from Mozilla, saying that I had correctly changed the password, but when I try to sign in, it says that the password is wrong. I tried several times with no success. Because I never did anything with my Android phone, I am able to access my Firefox there. I have no idea what to do next.
